特記事項: 【合併】Career Seminar for International Organizations　（国連・外交統括センター）/Career Seminar for International Organizations　（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）/Career Seminar for International Organizations　（経営戦略研究科）
関連科目: Seminar in Global Communication, Internship in the United Nations, Management of International Organizations
授業の概要・背景: Career development professionals, mentors and external advisors give advice, comments and support for revising the plan and realising it successfully. Today's leaders are expected to have an ability to thoroughly analyze as well as communicate persuasively with clarity. This course will enhance the capacity of each student to present himself/herself well in both public and private settings. Customized/smaller workshops are developed for students to improve their presentation skills and prepare for competency-based and other types of interviews. High quality CV writing, (to review concise policy relevant letters and CVs linking the course of Seminar in Global Communication and Internship in the United Nations), handling negotiations, networking, etc. are included. The course's resource persons provide a simulated roadmap of career plans based upon their experiences as a frame of reference.

第1回:
4/13 Introduction, overview of the class and  Understanding JD (Nishino):
Objectives: Students will understand basic composition and key points of UN Job Descriptions.
Contents: Presentation and peer review of JD.
Students will find one vacancy, obtain the JD and analyse necessary skills and competencies.
第2回:
4/20 Curriculum Vitae preparation (Nishino):
Objectives: Students will be able to prepare their Curriculum Vitae.
Contents: Lecture and discussion. Peer review of CV and identify points for improvement.
Students will prepare and finalize CV.
第3回:
4/27 Cover letter preparation (Nishino)
Objectives: Students will be able to prepare effective cover letter for international career.
Contents: Lecture and discussion. Peer review of Cover letter, and identify points for improvement.
Students will prepare and finalize a cover letter.
第4回:
5/11 Competency-Based Interview (Nishino)
Objective: Students will develop UN competency-based interview skills.
Contents: Students will practice mock interviews against the positions which they chose during the previous sessions. By interviewing each other, students will realize some technical as well as psychological aspects of interview. This session will be filmed and viewed within the session for reflection and further improvements.After completion of all interviews, students will reflect the points for further improvements and preparation for internship.
Students will prepare for a mock interview.
第5回:
5/18 Presentation for jobs (Murata)
Students to learn by doing their own simulation and presentation of a given subject (relevant the on- going research/intern placement) by resource person. The selection of the subject will be discussed in advance. “First 5 minutes” would be the key to attract the audience. The participants are required to comment on each presentation on the spot to further improve skills. The participants’ presentation should be filmed and reviewed in the class.
Reference: “Craft the Beginning”, HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations by Nancy Duarte, 2012 ISBN:978-1-4221-8710-4
第6回: 5/25  (Murata) The previous reflection of the soft spots and the strengths will be highlighted for the participants. Resource person and the participants are to review the “Common Ground” to refine each presentation with specific interventions. The presentation should be filmed again.
Reference: “Common Ground”, HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations by Nancy Duarte, 2012 ISBN:978-1-4221-8710-4
第7回: 6/1  (Murata) The participants will be given an opportunity for impromptu speech (selection of theme is at random. Ability to be tested from the various angles) by resource person based upon the experience of previous sessions. The speech/presentation should be prepared within 5minutes followed by 5minutes presentations. The presentations will be filmed.
第8回: 6/8 (Murata) Resource person will wrap up the points of the last 3 sessions together with the participants in taking a close look at the videoed presentations. The participants are required to submit “one page” wrap up paper within 48 hours.
Reference: “Anticipate Resistance”, HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations by Nancy Duarte, 2012 ISBN:978-1-4221-8710-4
第9回:
6/15 (Kukita):
Objectives and process, expectations by students, preparing for the final presentation, Life planning and careers in 21st century
Assignment: Students prepare their own personal mission, strategy and goals
第10回:
6/22 UN Competency framework (Kukita):
Development of competency framework at UN and other international organizations
UN core values: Integrity, Professionalism, Respect for diversity
Assignment: Students self-assess their own competencies.
第11回:
6/29 Assessing competencies (Kukita):
UN core competencies and managerial competencies.
Assessing competency requirement of the job opening
Assignment: Each student prepares a zero draft of life, career, competency development plan, and value statement
第12回: 7/6 (Kukita) Students present their life, career and competency development plans based on their own missions, visions, career path and competency assessment, which will guide their personal and professional development in life. End of course evaluation.
Assignment: Students prepare for their presentations on their life, career and competency development plans, version 1.0.
第13回: 7/13(Konishi) Understanding theory and concept of transferable skills that will be useful in long-term career development,  and learn how to utilize them in the real global working environment.
Prior readings are provided. Read carefully and prepare for the class discussions.
第14回: Students will submit JD+CV+cover letter+short report to Nishino.
